headline: Psalm of the Tired Evening
description: A psalm of exhaustion, drifting faith, and surrender into God’s carrying strength.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
resonantThread: The quiet endurance of faith when clarity fades — the soul afloat on God’s current rather than its own strength.
whyItMatters: This piece marks a crucial threshold in Aleksandr's spiritual development: a shift from striving to surrender, from decision to rest. It reveals the moment when fatigue ceases to be defeat and becomes trust — a holy drift in which God carries what the heart cannot. It expands the Candle-line by introducing a waterborne phase of guidance through buoyancy instead of will.

motifMap.meaning: The self’s fragile but persistent flame

motifMap.meaning: The fading clarity of effort before surrender

articleExcerpt: “So tonight I lay it down. Tonight I rest. I do not have to decide. You carry what I cannot.”
sourceFragments: I am tired today. The words come in bursts and vanish.
Your Spirit whispers 'stay.' My heart whispers 'go.'
So tonight I lay it down. Tonight I rest.
